skill.name: doc-coauthoring
skill.description: Guide users through a structured workflow for co-authoring documentation. Use when user wants to write documentation, proposals, technical specs, decision docs, or similar structured content. This workflow helps users efficiently transfer context, refine content through iteration, and verify the doc works for readers. Trigger when user mentions writing docs, creating proposals, drafting specs, or similar documentation tasks.

security_audit.summary: Official skill from anthropics/skills repository containing only procedural workflow guidance. The skill guides users through documentation creation without executing any code. Risk factors (network, filesystem) are benign - file creation is limited to documentation files created with user input, and network references only describe integration options without making actual calls.

content.value_statement: Complex documents fail when context and structure are weak. This workflow guides you through context gathering, drafting, and reader testing stages to create documents that work for readers.
actual_capabilities: Guide users through three-stage workflow: context gathering, refinement, and reader testing
Ask structured questions about audience, impact, constraints, and document purpose
Create document scaffolds with section placeholders for iterative drafting
Facilitate section-by-section brainstorming, curation, and refinement
Run reader testing to predict questions and identify gaps before publication
limitations: Does not access external documents without integrations enabled
Requires user input for all content and decisions
Does not verify facts, links, or technical accuracy
Reader testing with sub-agents only available on supported platforms

use_cases.title: Draft a PRD
use_cases.description: Build a product requirements document with goals, scope, and key decisions through guided sections.

use_cases.title: Write a technical spec
use_cases.description: Capture architecture decisions, trade-offs, and implementation steps with structured prompts and refinement.

use_cases.title: Create a decision doc
use_cases.description: Document options, rationale, and risks with iterative drafting and reader testing validation.

prompt_templates.title: Start a document
prompt_templates.prompt: Guide me through your doc co-authoring workflow for a technical spec. Ask context questions and build the section outline.

prompt_templates.title: Draft a section
prompt_templates.prompt: We are drafting the Approach section. Ask clarifying questions, brainstorm options, then draft the section content.

prompt_templates.title: Refine a section
prompt_templates.prompt: Refine my proposal section after I choose what to keep and remove. Use iterative edits until it is clear.

prompt_templates.title: Reader testing
prompt_templates.scenario: You want a fresh reader check
prompt_templates.prompt: Run reader testing on my document. Predict reader questions and report any gaps that need fixes.

output_examples.input: Help me draft a decision doc for migrating our API gateway
output: Initial context questions about audience, impact, and constraints
Proposed document structure with section placeholders
Drafted core decision section after brainstorming and curation
Predicted reader questions to validate clarity and identify gaps

output_examples.input: Guide me through creating a product requirements document
output: Clarifying questions about target users, success metrics, and timeline
Suggested section structure for a comprehensive PRD
Brainstormed feature list with user story options
Refined goals section with acceptance criteria

best_practices: Provide a focused context dump before drafting begins
Start with the section that has the most uncertainty
Use reader testing to discover hidden assumptions and ambiguities
anti_patterns: Skipping context gathering and jumping directly to a full draft
Editing the document without sharing changes back for feedback
Ignoring reader testing when multiple stakeholders will read the document

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, the workflow skill is designed to work across all Claude platform products.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It relies entirely on your input and does not verify facts or external data.

faq.question: Can it integrate with external docs or chat tools?
faq.answer: It can use connected tools when available; otherwise you must paste content directly.

faq.question: How is my data handled?
faq.answer: Content stays in the session unless you connect external tools or integrations.

faq.question: What if the draft feels too generic?
faq.answer: Provide more specific context and request additional refinement cycles until it matches your needs.

faq.question: How does it compare to freeform drafting?
faq.answer: It adds structured steps, iterative refinement, and reader testing to reduce gaps and improve clarity.
